text: Hello Manmeet - yes apprenticeships definitely a good way to learn practically on the job as well as getting some theoretical skills under your belt. Again it depends on what your passionate about.  Are you going to get sponsorship? Have you thought about approaching any organisations or looked around for apprenticeship schemes. Try this government website as a start  <https://www.gov.uk/apply-apprenticeship>   <https://www.getingofar.gov.uk/>.    A number of companies now have to fund apprenticeships through the apprenticeship levy scheme to ensure apprenticeship is to a high standard.  Hopefully the sites will give you some hints and tips.

attachments.title: Find an apprenticeship
attachments.text: Register your profile, search vacancies and apply for an apprenticeship - you must be 16 or over

attachments.title: Get Your Career Going | GET IN GO FAR
attachments.text: Meet the apprentices. Getting skills. Getting Paid. Getting degrees.
